entries.text: Uniregistry is looking for a talented and passionate engineer to build and maintain a world-class registry and registrar. This position requires the ability to analyze and implement elegant solutions to complex problems while contributing to the development of reusable components
entries.title: Senior Applications Engineer

entries.author: gabor_szabo
entries.text: Would you like to support the Perl Weekly? A Perl Job ad in the Perl Weekly, like the one above, will reach almost 6000 Perl developers. People like you, who are enthusiastic about Perl and not just use it as an add-on tool.
entries.title: Supporting the Perl Weekly?

entries.author: sawyer_x
entries.text: The Dancer book kickstarter has 6 days and 8 thousand euros to do.
entries.title: Help us sponsor the Dancer book!

entries.author: peter_rabbitson
entries.text: An update on Peter's Kickstarter to be able to focus on Open Source/CPAN development for 2016.
entries.title: Suspending efforts on my #riba2016 crowdfunding campaign, looking forward to my own Xmas

entries.author: peteris_krumins
entries.text: Peteris's Browserling (a cross-browser testing solution) was featured by ProductHunt.com, a site featuring and ranking different software. Good to know Browersling is doing good; interesting to learn about that ProductHunt site thingie.
entries.title: Browserling was product of the day on Product Hunt!

entries.author: david_farrell
entries.text: David made a cool "Larry Wall, hero of the revolution" t-shirt (if you want one, the Kickstarter is still ongoing, hurry!). He shares here the how he uses Gimp and Inkscape to create the t-shirt's picture.
entries.title: Making the Larry Wall shirt

entries.author: curtis_ovid_poe
entries.text: Ovid teases us with can be described as a tantalizing textual trailer to his upcoming space MMORPG, Veure.
entries.title: The Veure MMORPG Saga Continues

entries.author: dave_cross
entries.text: The London Perl Workshop is going to happen in a few days, and it looks like it's going to be awesome.
entries.title: London Perl Workshop 2015

entries.author: david_golden
entries.text: A new release of MongoDB is coming up. And a new trial version of its  driver is already accessible on CPAN. MongoDB peeps you know what that means.
entries.title: Getting ready for MongoDB 3.2: new features, new Perl driver beta

entries.author: matt_trout
entries.text: Either for abyss-level bug hunting, or interactive toying with the language, REPLs are invaluable. Matt reviews some of the  proeminent Perl REPL out there for us.
entries.title: Interactive shells

entries.author: sinan_unur
entries.text: There is an an optimization coming for Perl 5.24 that might boost some benchmarks by 25% to 40%. Sinan gives the nitty gritty details of this upcoming nitro injection to the Perl engine.
entries.title: Free go faster stripes for your Perl programs

entries.author: yanick_champoux
entries.text: A new module that turns JSON schemas into Type::Tiny types.
entries.title: Say 'Hello' to JSON::Schema::AsType

entries.author: makoto_nozaki
entries.text: A grant to merge stabilize and merge Test::Stream and Test::Simple into perl-blead has been approved.
entries.title: November 2015 Grant Votes

entries.author: timotimo
entries.text: Quite a lot of stuff happening in Perl6-land this week: a new Rakudo version, a new tutorial, a new Advent calendar, and lots of small stuff falling into place.
entries.title: Arrays Shape Up, Curli Lands and Supply Splits

entries.author: jonathan_worthington
entries.text: Last time, John was counting 40 tickets standing between us and Christmas. Now the number is down to 20.
entries.title: Getting closer to Christmas

entries.author: miguel_prz
entries.text:
Great modules released last week;
MetaCPAN weekly report;
StackOverflow Perl report.
entries.title: NICEPERL's lists

entries.text: Are you looking for a place to contribute. Here is the 100 most recently uploaded modules that are either missing the link to their repository, have no Travis-CI enabled, or have no license in the META files.
entries.title: Monitoring the most recent uploads to CPAN

header: With December comes back a beloved Perl tradition: the Advent calendars. In other seasonal news, Christmas is getting ever closer for Perl 6. And on a slightly more "bah humbug"ish note, the various Perl-related Kickstarters aren't doing so well right now. But hey, this season is known for its miracles, so... we never know. In the meantime, enjoy! ~ `/anick
subject: Advent Season
